name: Alicorn Headguard

attributes.Resists: fire +5%, earth +5%, energy +5%, ice +5%, holy +5%, death +5%, physical +5%

notes:
Notes
Part of the Alicorn Set.
It is a possible reward of the Primal Ordeal Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Primal Set through the Hazard System.

name: Amazon Helmet
notes:
Notes
A mysterious and rarely seen helmet. For a long time, it was nothing more than a myth. Many Tibians talked about this helmet, but very few knew how to obtain one. It is only dropped during orc raids on Femor Hills. It is a part of the Amazon Set.

name: Ancient Tiara
notes:
Notes
Can be seen on the second floor of the Explorer Society in Port Hope. This item has no armor value as it is only known for being decorative. This item is one of the Pharaoh Rares and is quite valuable as it is dropped exclusively by Vashresamun who is infrequently hunted.

name: Antler-Horn Helmet

attributes.Attributes: sword fighting +1, axe fighting +1, club fighting +1

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Arboreal Crown
notes:
Notes
Part of the Arboreal Set.
It is a possible reward of the Primal Ordeal Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Primal Set through the Hazard System.

name: Arcanomancer Regalia
notes:
Notes
Part of the Arcanomancer Set.
It is a possible reward of the Primal Ordeal Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Primal Set through the Hazard System.

name: Bandana
notes:
Notes
For now just a decoration piece because any real purpose remains unknown. 
In contrast to general assumptions, it is not part of the Pirate Set, the hat piece of which being not the Bandana but the Pirate Hat.

name: Batwing Hat
notes:
Notes
It increases Magic Level by 1 when worn. It has the same attributes as Hat of the Mad but is 1oz lighter and harder to obtain, which raises its price.

name: Blue Spectacles
notes:
Notes
Obtained during the Opticording Sphere Quest.

name: Bonelord Helmet
notes:
Notes
A very rare helmet. Back in the days people would pay huge amounts of money for this item. It has been made easier to loot this helmet so it's value dropped. It is part of the Bonelord Set. Due to its rarity, item collectors pay a good cash for it.

name: Brass Button
notes:
Notes
Used to obtain the first addon of the Formal Dress Outfits. It isn't consumed on use.

name: Brass Helmet
notes:
Notes
Useful helmet for players in Rookgaard, also part of the Brass Set. Obtainable from the Bear Room Quest in Rookgaard.

name: Bridal Wreath
notes:
Notes
Use it on Black Skull (Quest) to obtain a Bridal Black Skull.
It can be obtained in a tree stump in the Yalahar section of the Time Travel Dungeon (here).

name: Broken Iks Headpiece
notes:
Notes
This item is one of the four required to obtain the first addon for the Ancient Aucar Outfits.

name: Broken Visor
notes:
Notes
It is one of the few creature items that is wearable, even when stacked. The arm value stays at 1 no matter how many visors you stack.

name: Ceremonial Mask
notes:
Notes
You can see it in treasure room in Ferumbras Tower and its data can be found on the Market. Bears a striking resemblance to the Full Helmet of the Ancients. The mask can show your blessings, just like Ceremonial Ankh.

Ferumbras Tower's Treasure Room

name: Chain Helmet
notes:
Notes
Although the Studded Helmet is more expensive and it has the same defense value as the Chain Helmet, many prefer the Studded Helmet because it is lighter. Part of the Chain Set.

name: Charmer's Tiara
notes:
Notes
A very beautiful decorative headpiece.

name: Cobra Crown
notes:
Notes
This expensive helmet was initially only dropped by Draken Elite, but since 2012 also by the Ghastly Dragon boss Hatebreeder. It is the best helmet without a level requirement that adds extra magic levels.

name: Cobra Hood

attributes.Attributes: sword fighting +1, club fighting +1, axe fighting +1

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Crest of the Deep Seas
notes:
Notes
Despite the name's connection to the sea, it does not act as a diving helmet. On the Test Server of 10.7 it was proposed by several testers that this helmet allow diving underwater, since its name implies a connection to the sea and the stats were very poor at the time. Instead, CipSoft added Ice Resistance and a Speed boost to it. Can be used as part of the Speed Set.

name: Crown Helmet
notes:
Notes
This is a good and fairly strong helmet used by most players and is part of the Crown Set. It's also pretty light, making it a decent helmet for any medium level Paladin, Mages would probably prefer a Hat of the Mad or an elemental Helmet such as a Terra Hood.
Obtainable from the Noble Armor Quest.

name: Crown
notes:
Notes
A very rare item. There is only one documented crown obtained in Tibia, in Lutabra. 
It first appeared when Knightmare (after broadcasting the giveaway) threw this item and a Crystal Wand as special rewards into the Thais temple in Antica in 2000. It was owned by a famous rare collector, Lightbringer, and later sold to an unknown player. It can be seen in the treasure rooms in Kazordoon, Maze of Lost Souls, Hellgate, Omruc's pharaoh room in Ankrahmun, in a tomb in the Isle of the Kings, in the room just south of Bunny Bonecrusher, Pits of Inferno reward room, and inside Morguthis' Treasure Room.

â€ŽCrown along with Blessed Shield and Dragon Scale Legs, seen in Nerana 2015.

name: Crusader Helmet
notes:
Notes
Most players prefer to use this over a Warrior Helmet, which has the same defence but is a bit heavier (by 16 oz) than Crusader Helmet, although it is more expensive.
Obtainable from the Crusader Helmet Quest.

name: Damaged Helmet
notes:
Notes

This item is obtained in the Helmet of the Ancients Quest by having an Ornamented Ankh in your inventory and going through the teleport in Dipthrah's Tomb.

name: Dark Helmet
notes:
Notes
A common helmet, many low level players use it. Had its graphics changed during 7.8 update to match the new Dark Armor graphic that was introduced during 7.6 update. It is the same in armor and weight as a Steel Helmet and a Strange Helmet. Part of the Dark Set.

Reward in the Alawar's Vault Quest.

name: Dark Whispers
notes:
Notes
This helmet can be imbued with Basic Epiphany (Magic Level bonus), but not with Intricate or Powerful Epiphany.

name: Dark Wizard's Crown (Activated)
notes:
Notes
This is an activated Dark Wizard's Crown. It will turn back into its regular state after a short moment.

name: Dark Wizard's Crown
notes:
Notes
It's TibiaMisterios' fansite item. If you use it, it will turn into a Dark Wizard's Crown (Activated) and look like this: . The creator of the Dark Wizard's Crown is Lupus Aurelius.
This item was awarded to three players during the Fansite Appreciation Day 2022. The winners were:

Thomax (Havera)
Mage Korz (Dibra)
Zarty Stark (Thyria)

name: Demon Helmet
notes:
Notes
It has been superseded by the Zaoan Helmet. The Demon Helmet is also a very good helmet for Mages who want to prioritize defense.
Obtainable in the Demon Helmet Quest.

name: Demon Mengu
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Demonfang Mask
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Depth Galea
notes:
Notes
The Depth Galea is used to dive underwater. Wearing it is required to be able to go underwater, but once there the helmet can be removed. However, without it players will take 5 times 20 Drowning damage kicking in after four seconds of standing still. It is useful out of the depths, too: some monsters, like Water Elementals, use drowning damage attacks.Part of the Depth Set. Functions as a lightweight, higher armored Helmet of the Deep.

name: Devil Helmet
notes:
Notes
It can be traded for a Piece of Hell Steel with A Sweaty Cyclops, also obtainable through the Devil Helmet Quest.

name: Dragon Scale Helmet
notes:
Notes
It can be seen in the Amazon Camp Treasure Room and is part of the Dragon Set.

Dragon Scale Helmet

name: Dreadfire Headpiece
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Dwarven Helmet
notes:
Notes
This helmet is a very rare loot from the Minotaur boss The Horned Fox. Dwarven Helmet's price skyrocketed after the implementation of Imbuing with the Winter Update 2016. This helmet itself has +2% physical resistance and additional 2 imbuing slots, additionally, it has no level and vocation requirements, making it a very interesting option mostly for mages becouse of extra resistance, but remember Dwarven Helmet CANNOT be imbued with extra Magic Level like all other non mage-exclusive helmets. If you are a knight or a paladin and you don't care about imbuements, Zaoan Helmet is a better option because it gives you a higher physical protection, its only downside is that it has 1 less imbuing slot.
Its rivals, Demon Helmet and Visage of the End Days, will only be better options if you want 2 imbuing slots or you are not taking more than 200 physical damage per hit. However, the Enchanted Werewolf Helmets would always protect more than a dwarven helmet, but they have level requirement (100) and no imbuing slots.

name: Eldritch Cowl
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Eldritch Hood
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Elite Draken Helmet
notes:
Notes
One of the rewards in the Wrath of the Emperor Quest.

name: Enchanted Werewolf Helmet (Axe)
notes:
Notes
To create an Enchanted Werewolf Helmet you have to talk to NPC Maeryn (hi â†’ werewolf helmet â†’ yes â†’ then choose vocation and weapon type). From now on, every time you use Moonlight Crystals on ANY Werewolf Helmet, it will be enchanted with new attributes depending on vocation and weapon type you have chosen. To create different enchantments return to NPC Maeryn and repeat the process.
 See also: Enchanted Werewolf Helmet

name: Enchanted Werewolf Helmet (Club)
notes:
Notes
To create an Enchanted Werewolf Helmet you have to talk to NPC Maeryn (hi â†’ werewolf helmet â†’ yes â†’ then choose vocation and weapon type). From now on, every time you use Moonlight Crystals on ANY Werewolf Helmet, it will be enchanted with new attributes depending on vocation and weapon type you have chosen. To create different enchantments return to NPC Maeryn and repeat the process.
 See also: Enchanted Werewolf Helmet

name: Enchanted Werewolf Helmet (Distance)
notes:
Notes
To create an Enchanted Werewolf Helmet you have to talk to NPC Maeryn (hi â†’ werewolf helmet â†’ yes â†’ then choose vocation and weapon type). From now on, every time you use Moonlight Crystals on ANY Werewolf Helmet, it will be enchanted with new attributes depending on vocation and weapon type you have chosen. To create different enchantments return to NPC Maeryn and repeat the process.
 See also: Enchanted Werewolf Helmet

name: Enchanted Werewolf Helmet (Magic)
notes:
Notes
To create an Enchanted Werewolf Helmet you have to talk to NPC Maeryn (hi â†’ werewolf helmet â†’ yes â†’ then choose vocation and weapon type). From now on, every time you use Moonlight Crystals on ANY Werewolf Helmet, it will be enchanted with new attributes depending on vocation and weapon type you have chosen. To create different enchantments return to NPC Maeryn and repeat the process.
 See also: Enchanted Werewolf Helmet

name: Enchanted Werewolf Helmet (Sword)
notes:
Notes
To create an Enchanted Werewolf Helmet you have to talk to NPC Maeryn (hi â†’ werewolf helmet â†’ yes â†’ then choose vocation and weapon type). From now on, every time you use Moonlight Crystals on ANY Werewolf Helmet, it will be enchanted with new attributes depending on vocation and weapon type you have chosen. To create different enchantments return to NPC Maeryn and repeat the process.
 See also: Enchanted Werewolf Helmet

name: Falcon Circlet
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Falcon Coif
notes:
Notes
This is one of the few helmets that can be worn by Knights which can be imbued with up to Tier 2 Epiphany (Magic Level boost) imbuements. It's also one of the few helmets available for Paladins with this property.

name: Feather Headdress
notes:
Notes
This item can only be obtained by killing Terror Birds which spawn in Tiquanda, Zao and the Arena and Zoo Quarter in Yalahar.Can be obtained from Shaggy Ogre Bags.

name: Ferumbras' Candy Hat
notes:
Notes
It was introduced to celebrate Tibia's 20th Anniversary.Despite what its name might suggest, this item is not edible.

name: Ferumbras' Hat
notes:
Notes
One of the most expensive items that is still obtainable. 
Needed for an addon of the male Mage Outfits and female Summoner Outfits.

An unreachable room with several Ferumbras' Hats in the Halls of Ascension.

name: Flower Wreath
notes:
Notes
Elegant wreath made of flowers, they are reasonably rare and a fine decoration. For many people these wreaths are valuable. It was first seen on June 1, 2009. Part of the Dryad Set.

name: Fur Cap
notes:
Notes
Most often used as decoration. Value may be high since it is only lootable from a rare-spawning boss creature.

name: Galea Mortis
notes:
Notes
Can be imbued with Powerful Epiphany, making it a competitor to Falcon Circlet and Gnome Helmet. Especially good in PvP since gives extra protection against sudden death runes.

name: Gill Gugel
notes:
Notes
Part of the Gill Set

name: Glacier Mask
notes:
Notes
It gives 4% protection from Ice Damage, but increases damage taken from Energy by 5%. It's a part of the Glacier Set.

name: Gnome Helmet
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Golden Crown
notes:
Notes
This is one of the prizes for the characters ranked first in the Tournament Triumph.

name: Golden Helmet
notes:
Notes
Arguably the best Helmet in the game and also part of the Golden Set. This rare item was obtainable a long time ago from the Daemon until later a certain update that proved to carry the first HOTS which still exists today. It can be seen in Hellgate Treasure Chamber, Morguthis Room and Pythius The Rotten's Treasure Room. Nowadays because of the world transfer system more servers have this legendary helmet.
CM Skerio wrote on November 21, 2021: "(...) items which cannot be gained in the game any longer and have to be acquired from other players, e.g. golden helmet (...)", which means that Golden Helmet isn't lootable neither from the boss monsters nor from the quests.

name: Golden Horned Helmet
notes:
Notes
This was one of the prizes for the characters ranked first in the Tournament Radiance. The Gilded Horned Helmet looks the same and can be bought in the Store, which also means it cannot be traded with other players.

name: Green Demon Helmet
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Gryphon Mask
notes:
Notes
Obtained in Kilmaresh Quest during the One last favor mission.

name: Hat of the Mad
notes:
Notes
An item very sought after by low to mid level mages since it increases magic level by one and is very lightweight.
Obtainable in the Mad Mage Room Quest.

name: Hellstalker Visor
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Helmet of Nature
notes:
Notes
Use the dead body of Dirtbeard to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
It looks the same as a Flower Bowl.
There is a chance of obtaining it in the Isle of Evil Quest.

name: Helmet of Ultimate Terror
notes:
Notes
Use the dead body of Monstor to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
It looks the same as a Pumpkinhead (Lit).
There is a chance of obtaining it in the Isle of Evil Quest.

name: Helmet of the Ancients (Enchanted)
notes:
Notes
This is a Helmet of the Ancients enchanted with a Small Ruby. The effect of the enchantment will only last for 30 minutes. According to this book, using a Soul Ruby will have a permanent effect.
Creating this helmet will grant you the achievement Hidden Powers.

name: Helmet of the Ancients
notes:
Notes
Pharaohs guard the pieces of the helmet. When you use it on a Small Ruby, it will be enchanted and turn into a Helmet of the Ancients (Enchanted), which has an additional 3 armor. This effect will only last for 30 minutes. According to this book, using a Soul Ruby will permanently increase this value.
Obtained through The Ancient Tombs Quest.
Enchanting this helmet with a Small Ruby will grant you the achievement Hidden Powers.

name: Helmet of the Deep
notes:
Notes
The Helmet of the Deep is used to dive underwater. Wearing it is required to be able to go underwater, but once there the helmet can be removed. However, without it players will take 5 times 20 Drowning damage kicking in after four seconds of standing still. It is useful out of the depths, too: some monsters, like Water Elementals, use drowning damage attacks. There is a 5,000 gp deposit for the helmet. You must be a member of the Explorer Society (beginning of the Explorer Society Quest - The Undersea Kingdom) and have at least the Rank of a Relic Hunter/Huntress to rent one. Renting one is not bound to any liabilities and you may return the helmet by saying 'return' to Captain Max.Players above level 150 may opt to use the Depth Galea instead, which has 6 more armor points and weighs 164 oz less.

name: Helmet of the Lost
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Horned Helmet
notes:
Notes
This helmet is owned by a few players on multiple servers ever since world transfers have been implemented. The helmet was a spawn that appeared at a map reset in the now Bright Sword Quest underneath the Outlaw Camp, in the old days. Map resets happened once every 4-6 months back then. The Horned Helmet to this day is a priceless item for collectors. Several others were obtained on other old servers, such as Antica, Premia, Secura, Isara, Lunara, and Amera.

Horned Helmet seen in Iona in 2015An unreachable Horned Helmet can be seen in Amazon Camp Treasure Room.One of very few Horned Helmets on Secura back in 2007.Horned Helmet and other rares on Pacera.

name: Horseman Helmet
notes:
Notes
A Helmet not commonly used by low level players.

name: Incandescent Crown
notes:
Notes
You can transform it into a Magical Tree  by using it on the floor inside a House or Guildhall that you own.
Rewarded to Paladins in the Cults of Tibia Quest.
 See also: Crowns

name: Iron Crown
notes:
Notes
You can transform it into a Magical Tree  by using it on the floor inside a House or Guildhall that you own.
Rewarded to Knights in the Cults of Tibia Quest.
 See also: Crowns

name: Iron Helmet
notes:
Notes
Not used much as a Helmet as most people prefer the Soldier Helmet because it is cheaper, easier to get, and is only 2 oz heavier. A good item for lootbags when sold to an NPC who buys them. There are rumors saying that there's a quest to obtain one in Rookgaard.

name: Jade Hat
notes:
Notes
Has 1 arm more than a Hat of the Mad but is also 2 oz heavier.

name: Jester Hat
notes:
Notes
A fancy hat, mostly used by clowns and jesters.

Obtained through the What a foolish Quest.

name: Krimhorn Helmet
notes:
Notes
Not often used since there are other helmets with the same armor value that are lighter, commonly looted and thus cheaper, such as the Dark Helmet and Steel Helmet.

name: Laurel Wreath
notes:
Notes
You can only read the text if you stand at two squares from it or closer. The Laurel Wreath was given to tutors on two occasions as a token of gratitude for their help.

3 wreaths were given by Grimrath to Abiston, Mirkaan and Zinina on December 23rd, 2011.
3 wreaths were given by Karvar to Lee kun, Parodox and Gogue da Terra de Magogue on January 19th, 2013.

name: Leaf Crown
notes:
Notes
You can transform it into a Magical Tree  by using it on the floor inside a House or Guildhall that you own.
Rewarded to Druids in the Cults of Tibia Quest.
 See also: Crowns

name: Leather Helmet
notes:
Notes
It's probably the first helmet someone finds or purchases. It is part of the Leather Set.

name: Legion Helmet
notes:
Notes
This is the best helmet in Rookgaard, it has the same defense value as a Viking Helmet but is lighter. After Christmas Update 2009 the value of Legion Helmet rose steeply because they are not dropped by Rotworms anymore but still needed for an outfit quest.
One is required for an addon of the Citizen Outfits Quest, both the mainland and Rookgaard quests. If you want to make the addon, it is recommended to get this helmet while still in Rookgaard.
This item can be obtained in the Dragon Corpse Quest, or the Present Box Quest in Rookgaard.
It can also be obtained in Dawnport through the Dawnport Legion Helmet Quest.

name: Lightning Headband
notes:
Notes
It gives 4% protection from Energy Damage, but increases damage taken from Earth by 5%. It's part of the Lightning Set.

name: Lion Spangenhelm
notes:
Notes
This helmet can be imbued with Basic and Intricate Epiphany (Magic Level bonus), but not with Powerful Epiphany.

name: Mage Hat
notes:
Notes
It is part of the set given to new Sorcerers and Druids in the Island of Destiny and in Dawnport. Used by a lot of mages under level 200 because it is the only mage-exclusive helmet with 2 imbuing slots under said level, which means it can be imbued with Powerful Epiphany (all mage helmets with native Magic level give up to +2), while the second slot can be used for Powerful Void.

name: Mage's Cap
notes:
Notes
A Mage's Cap is needed for the Elementalist Outfits Quest.

name: Magician Hat
notes:
Notes
While part of the Pharaoh Rares, it is about ten times more common than Rahemos' other rare, the Twin Axe.

name: Magma Monocle
notes:
Notes
It gives 4% protection from Fire Damage, but increases damage taken from Ice by 5% (was 4% before Update 8.2). It is part of the Magma Set. Its value has decreased a lot, just like other elemental helmets, because it has become very common.

name: Maliceforged Helmet

attributes.Attributes: sword fighting +2, axe fighting +2, club fighting +2

notes:
Notes
Can not be imbued with Powerful Epiphany.

name: Mighty Helm of Green Sparks
notes:
Notes
Use the dead body of Doctor Perhaps to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
Looks similar to a Steel Helmet, but with green sparks.

There is a chance of obtaining it in the Isle of Evil Quest.

name: Mining Helmet
notes:
Notes
Dwarfs could use this while mining. Provides 4 squares of permanent yellow light, a bit weaker than a Torch.
It looks the same as Budrik's Mining Helmet.

A reward from the Tibia Tales Quest (To Outfox a Fox Quest).

name: Mystic Turban
notes:
Notes
It can be traded to NPC Irmana for a Blue Piece of Cloth.

name: Odd Hat
notes:
Notes
Use the dead body of Dirtbeard to have a chance of getting it. It is proof that you have slain him.
It looks the same as a Party Cake.
There is a chance of obtaining it in the Isle of Evil Quest.

name: Pair of Earmuffs
notes:
Notes
A rather rare item just used for decoration. Not recommended to sell to NPCs.
Can be obtained from an Unrealized Dream.

name: Party Hat
notes:
Notes
Introduced during Tibia's 10th Anniversary where they were easily obtained using Surprise Bags that were looted from many monsters and then again during Tibia's 15th Anniversary. Also given away by Ned Nobel.
When the hat is equipped on the helmet slot, it will let loose confetti over when used.

Could be bought from Stan only during Masquerade Days.
Use it 200 times while wearing it to get the achievement Party Animal.

name: Pirate Hat
notes:
Notes
A part of the Pirate Set. Looks similar to Brutus Bloodbeard's Hat.

Needed for the Meriana Quest.
Can be obtained by completing the Waterfall Quest.

name: Porcelain Mask
notes:
Notes
It is one of the four permanent protector equipments against Mana Drain, the other three being the Witch Hat, Depth Ocrea and the Starlight Vial. The last one and the Porcelain Mask do not have vocation requirement.
You can obtain one every 5 days when the First Dragon Quest is active. 3 are needed for the Festive Outfits Quest.

name: Post Officer's Hat
notes:
Notes
Sometimes used as decoration.
Item obtained in the Postman Quest.
Also useful during the Thieves Guild Quest, if you are an Archpostman.

name: Prismatic Helmet
notes:
Notes
Part of the Prismatic Set. The best helmet for knights above level 150. An alternative is the Zaoan Helmet which has the same defense and physical resistance but no level requirement.

name: Ragnir Helmet
notes:
Notes
Less common than the Dark Helmet and Steel Helmet, it weighs less by 15.00 oz.

name: Reflecting Crown
notes:
Notes
You can transform it into a Magical Tree  by using it on the floor inside a House or Guildhall that you own.
Rewarded to Sorcerers in the Cults of Tibia Quest.
 See also: Crowns

name: Royal Helmet
notes:
Notes
A popular helmet, most high level Players have it because it is relatively common. It is one of the best in Tibia.
2 Royal Helmets can be traded for a Fighting Spirit to Haroun or Yaman.

name: Rubber Cap
notes:
Notes
At level 70 this becomes a nice alternative to Terra Hood.

name: Rusty Winged Helmet
notes:
Notes
You can dig rusty winged helmets at Vigintia's treasure hunting zone.It was introduced to celebrate Tibia's 20th Anniversary.

name: Santa Hat
notes:
Notes
Used as decoration.
You can get one by trading 50 Christmas Tokens to Ruprecht on Vega.

name: Sedge Hat
notes:
Notes
The name of this item was changed from Coolie Hat to Sedge Hat because "coolie" is a derogatory term used mainly in Eastern Asia, India and Guyana. The name change was proposed by Brother of Conway.
Obtainable from the An Interest In Botany Quest. You give this item to NPC Cranky Lizard Crone in exchange for the second addon of the Wayfarer Outfits.

name: Shamanic Mask
notes:
Notes
It can be sold to NPC Mugruu after finishing Vuzrog's questline.
Can be obtained from Shaggy Ogre Bags.

name: Shroud of Despair
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Silver Mask
notes:
Notes
Part of the Kilmaresh Quest.

name: Skull Helmet
notes:
Notes
It has the same defence as a Royal Helmet, but is 6.00 oz lighter.

name: Soldier Helmet
notes:
Notes
A cheap and good helmet that many level 10-15 players use. Next, players should buy a Dark Helmet or Steel Helmet. Knights can also get this helmet on the Island of Destiny and in Dawnport. Due to a bug, the helmet was also briefly brought to Rookgaard from Dawnport.

name: Spiritthorn Helmet

attributes.Attributes: sword fighting +3, axe fighting +3, club fighting +3, 13 damage reflection

notes:
Notes
Part of the Spiritthorn Set. It is a possible reward of the Primal Ordeal Quest, which guarantees one random item from the Primal Set through the Hazard System.
It has Damage Reflection, and is one of the few helmets for Knights that can be imbued with up to Tier 2 Epiphany (Magic Level boost).

name: Spooky Hood
notes:
Notes
Item needed to get first addon of the Poltergeist Outfits.

name: Steel Helmet
notes:
Notes
A good helmet, but is somewhat expensive and a Dark Helmet (which has the same armor and weight) is easier to get, for example from a Cyclops. Also obtainable from Steel Helmet Quest. Part of the Steel Set.
Item obtained in the Steel Helmet Quest.

name: Stoic Iks Casque
notes:
Notes
Can not be imbued with Powerful Epiphany.

name: Stoic Iks Headpiece

attributes.Augments: Wrath of Nature -> +5% Critical Extra Damage

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Strange Helmet
notes:
Notes
This is a semi-rare item that most people just sell to the Djinn.

name: Studded Helmet
notes:
Notes
Has the same armor as a Chain Helmet but it's lighter. Part of the Studded Set.

name: Terra Helmet

attributes.Attributes: sword fighting +2, club fighting +2, axe fighting +2

notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Terra Hood
notes:
Notes
It gives 4% protection from Earth Damage but increases Fire Damage by 5%. It's very light which makes it ideal for low level mages. Part of the Terra Set.

name: The Crown of the Percht Queen (Fire)

attributes.Classification: Plants, Animal Products, Food and DrinkCreature ProductsHelmets

notes:
Notes
It is one of the few creature items that is wearable.

name: The Crown of the Percht Queen (Ice)

attributes.Classification: Plants, Animal Products, Food and DrinkCreature ProductsHelmets

notes:
Notes
It is one of the few creature items that is wearable.

name: The Epic Wisdom
notes:
Notes
The official TibiaWiki.com.br item. It was created by Insane Jack.
This item was awarded to four players during the Fansite Appreciation Day 2022. The winners were:

Akatski Star (Quelibra)
Shingeki Omyojin (Kalibra)
Crazyzenho (Libertabra)
Mangusia (Antica)

name: Tiara of Power
notes:
Notes
Looks like  when equipped. Increases your Mana and Hitpoints Regeneration for 60 minutes (1 hours) by the rate of 2 HP and 8 MP per 6 seconds, which means it will recover 4800 MP and 1200 HP in total. Tiara of Power can't be repaired. It disappears after using for 60 minutes.

name: Tribal Mask
notes:
Notes
Found in southern Tiquanda/Trapwood (semi-rare). It has the exact same gp-to-weight ratio as pure gold coins.5 are needed for an addon of the Shaman Outfits.Can be obtained from Shaggy Ogre Bags.

name: Viking Helmet
notes:
Notes
The Viking Helmet provides as much armor as the Legion Helmet but weighs more, it's a good item for bringing to mainland and selling it there. It is part of the Viking Set. It is common to find this helmet in the Skeleton tomb, which can be accessed by digging a hole in the middle grave, located here.
This item can be obtained in the Katana Quest in Rookgaard.

name: Visage of the End Days
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Warrior Helmet
notes:
Notes
Heavy helmet compared to the Crusader Helmet which is lighter and has the same armor rating. Also, the price is lower because of its weight and because it is quite easy to loot.
It can be obtained from Deeper Fibula Quest.
4 warrior helmets can be traded by Haroun (Blue Djinn Fortress) or Yaman (Green Djinn Fortress) for 1 Flask of Warrior's Sweat.

name: Werewolf Helmet
notes:
Notes
It can be enchanted to get an Enchanted Werewolf Helmet. To create an Enchanted Werewolf Helmet you have to talk to NPC Maeryn (hi - werewolf helmet - yes - choose vocation and weapon type). From now on, every time you use Moonlight Crystals on ANY Werewolf Helmet, it will be enchanted with new attributes depending on vocation and weapon type you have chosen. To create different enchantments, return to NPC Maeryn and repeat the process. Every enchanting lasts for 60 minutes, after that you need to use Moonlight Crystals on the helmet again.
Keep in mind that enchanting a Werewolf Helmet causes it to lose its +15 speed bonus until enchanting wears off. Some people don't enchant it because of the speed bonus, but it's not always worth to spent so much money to earn extra +15 speed, for more information check Speed Breakpoints.
 See also: Enchanted Werewolf Helmet

name: Winged Helmet
notes:
Notes
Contrary to popular belief, this helmet has never granted speed, ultimate protection beyond its healthy defensive powers, or anything else.
This item is very rare, even though it was illegally duplicated a long time ago. There should be around 10 of these helmets existing, initially on Antica.

It can be seen in Morguthis Room and Pythius The Rotten's Treasure Room.Winged Helmet and other rares in Pythius the Rotten's Treasure RoomWinged Helmet and other rares on Pacera

name: Witch Hat
notes:
Notes
Despite the item's stats, it's sold for a decent price due to the fact that it is a rare item in most of the servers, only looted seldom from Witches. It is also a permanent protector against Mana Drain, which is a rather uncommon attribute.

name: Wood Cape
notes:
Notes
This object has no notes.

name: Yalahari Mask
notes:
Notes
It increases magic level by two when worn.
Is part of the Yalahari Set. It rivals the best mage-exclusive helmets with the same increase of Magic level +2, unless you need the native damage protection of those.
Obtained through the In Service of Yalahar Quest.

name: Zaoan Helmet
notes:
Notes
Part of the Zaoan Set. It is better than the Demon Helmet, since the Demon Helmet has one armor value more, which blocks 0.7 damage on average, while the Zaoan Helmet has 5% protection against Physical Damage, which blocks at least 1 damage. 
If a creature hits an average of 100 damage every hit, Demon Helmet will reduce the damage with a minimum of 4.8 and a maximum of 8.5 while Zaoan Helmet will reduce it with a minimum of 4.3 and maximum of 7.6 with an additional of 5%.
In the end, Zaoan Helmet will reduce the damage by 9min and 12max compared to Demon helmet with 5 min and 9 max.
Dwarven Helmet only reduces the damage by 2.9 min and 5.7 max with an additional amount of 2% which goes towards reducing 4.8 min and 7.6 max. Keep in mind that "100 damage" was used for the calculation. The price of the Zaoan Helmet has decreased since the Elite Draken Helmet was implemented because it was first used by many Paladins.
